column1: Dedovsk (Russian: Де́довск) is a town in Istrinsky District of Moscow Oblast
column3: located 38 kilometers (24 mi) west of Moscow and 30 kilometers (19 mi) southeast of Istra
column4: the administrative center of the district. Population: 29
column7: 740 (1989 Census). It was previously known as Dedovo/Dedovsky (until 1940).

column1: It was first mentioned in 1573 as the village of Dedovo (Де́дово)
column2: which would turn into a bigger settlement in the 18th century. In 1913
column3: a textile factory was built in the area
column4: which would give birth to the settlement of Dedovsky (Де́довский) and absorb the village of Dedovo. In 1940
column5: the settlement was granted town status and given its present name.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column4: incorporated within Istrinsky District as the Town of Dedovsk. As a municipal division
column5: the Town of Dedovsk is incorporated within Istrinsky Municipal District as Dedovsk Urban Settlement.
